column4: I have two 250 hard drives. In any other version of Ubuntu it sees the one with XP as sda In 8.04 it sees it as sdb?
probably some change in the kernel code related to SATA. I think that's exactly what UUID's were made for? ;)

a UUID is an alternative way to identify a partition, as I understand it. Instead of saying "use device number X on this bus" it says "use the partition with the UUID <some random unique string>". Correct me, if I'm wrong.
